first deployed in the lake 22 20s and
predating even the hyperion class the
Earth Alliance Nova class dreadnought is
one of the largest and most powerful
military vessels ever commissioned by
Earthforce serving with distinction
across the dilgar war the earth-minbari
war and the Earth Alliance Civil War at
a length of 1,500 and 2.1 meters the
simple and angular space frame of the
Nova class proved incredibly reliable
with the design even being duplicated
many years after the Nova's introduction
to serve as the basis for the much
renowned Omega class destroyer the Nova
carries a crew of only 250 but is
designed to double as a heavy troop
carrier offering bunk space for up to
8,000 troops and making the vessels
extremely popular with the Earthforce
Marine Corps armed with 18 high-yield
twin plasma cannons each fixed to a
large out rigged turret in placement as
well as six particle beam weapons and to
fusion missile launchers the Nova class
is literally covered in powerful weapon
systems the ship forgoes a simulated
gravity hab and suffers from an
unfavorable thrust to mass ratio instead
being wholeheartedly dedicated to direct
attack power
this lack of versatility gives the ship
a short operational range and makes the
vessel unsuitable for a great deal of
mission profiles but when properly
employed the Nova class proves itself as
one of the deadliest warships in use by
the younger races in addition to its
massive weapons complement the Nova
class also carries an embarked wing of
36 Starfury Aurora
space superiority fighters these crafts
provide an effective defensive screen
for the Nova against hostile strike
craft and also allow the ship to react
to threats and changing objectives
faster than its own limited agility can
sustain in some instances portions of a
Nova's Starfury wing are replaced by
assault units such as marine gun ships
and invader class breaching pods
allowing the Nova to deploy its huge
troop compliments in aggressive boarding
actions by the outbreak of the
earth-minbari war
the Nova class dreadnought had fallen
into the role of a heavy weapons
platform for a typical Earthforce
flotilla it was apparent that the vessel
was largely unsuitable for independent
deployment as its low maneuverability
and relatively small array of
interceptor point defense systems
allowed hostile fleets to flank and
defeat the dreadnought when properly
coordinated instead the ships were
deployed with extensive escorts of Omega
Hyperion and a limp
glass vessels tasked with screening the
dreadnaughts from attack and allowing
them to bring their enormous firepower
to bear from a position of safety across
the earth-minbari war
almost the entire serving line of Nova
Class dreadnoughts were destroyed by the
minbari with only a few vessels
surviving past the minbari surrender the
ships were able to put up more of a
fight than most Earth Alliance vessels
when engaged with minbari warships even
managing to damage and rout minbari war
cruiser jean rare occasions in spite of
this the Nova's lack of adaptability
left Earthforce uninterested in renewing
its production cycle for peacetime
following the war
Earthforce shifted its focus toward the
Nova's more lightly armed successor the
Omega class destroyer the Omega class
was far better suited to long-range
missions offering a centrifugal gravity
hab and more reliable engine systems but
the vessels design would have been
impossible without the sturdy space
frame of the Nova Class production of
the older dreadnaughts did not cease
entirely but was heavily limited and
most Nova class vessels that remained in
service were predominantly used as heavy
troop carriers and orbital support craft
